Description: Glazed composition pectoral: in the form of a pylon, or temple gateway. It depicts the god Anubis as a jackal, with a winged 'wedjat', or sacred eye, in the upper left-hand corner. The colour blue connotes resurrection, as often remarked, and the colour yellow alludes to the sun, itself a powerful symbol of resurrection. The pectoral has eight suspension-holes.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E. T. Whyte, "Notes on Pectorals", in ‘Proceedings of the Society of Biblical Archaeology’ 15 (1893-93), p. 313; Riccardelli in P. B.Vandiver et al. (eds.), 'Material Issues in Art & Archaeology' VI (San Francisco, 2001).
Bibliographic references: Friedman 1998 / Gifts of the Nile: Ancient Egyptian Faience (161)
